# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is how you can implement the requested function in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width || length(result) == 0
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
    end
    return result
end

println(wrap_string("This is a test. This is only a test.", 10))
```

In this function, we split the input string into words by space. Then, for each word, we check if it can be added to the current line without exceeding the text width (plus one character for the space). If not, we start a new line. We also add an extra newline in between paragraphs (if any), and a space between words within a single paragraph. The resulting string is then returned as output.
